items.sentence: Tom saw a person with a scary looking face today.
Tom took off his glasses and rubbed his forehead.
Tom tore out a couple of pages from his notebook.
Tom tossed the rotten apple into the garbage can.
Tom tried to stay awake, but he soon fell asleep.
I\'m not making a decision until I hear from Tom.
I\'m not sure anyone would be willing to help me.
Be sure to call home before you leave the office.
I\'m the one who\'ll most likely have to do that.
Tom isn\'t afraid of snakes, even poisonous ones.
Tom can stay here a little longer if he wants to.
Tom is the one who helped Mary with her homework.
Why don\'t you just tell Tom how you\'re feeling?
Why don\'t you just tell me what\'s on your mind?
I could never fool you, even when you were small.
I suspect that Tom won\'t tell Mary who did that.
I think I\'ll stay in Boston for a few more days.
Tom was happy that his landlord lowered the rent.
Tom didn\'t wear the tie Mary wanted him to wear.
Tom doesn\'t allow his children to eat junk food.
